snippet: The vote had been called by Prime Minister Manuel Valls after a cabinet reshuffle purged leftists who were critical of divisive austerity measures.
abstract: France's embattled Socialist government narrowly wins parliamentary vote of confidence aimed at shoring up support for tough economic policy changes; vote gives Prime Min Manuel Valls platform to push through tough reforms dividing the left.

byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The vote had been called by Prime Minister Manuel Valls after a cabinet reshuffle purged leftists who were critical of divisive austerity measures.

headline.main: French Premier Prevails in Confidence Vote
headline.print_headline: French Premier Prevails in Confidence Vote
